adjective.description: Having the form of a circle.
examples: the building features a circular atrium

adjective.description: (of an argument) already containing an assumption of what is to be proved, and therefore fallacious.
(of a letter or advertisement) for distribution to a large number of people.

noun.description: A letter or advertisement which is distributed to a large number of people.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French circulier, from late Latin circularis, from Latin circulus small ring (see circle).
